intro: Vantanea paraensis, commonly known as the Paraense Vantanea, is a flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest of Brazil. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom during the wet season. The plant typically grows as an understory shrub, reaching heights of up to 1.5 meters. Its leaves are ovate with a smooth surface, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Vantanea paraensis is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
